newsitem.title: USA: GOLF-LOPEZ WINS RAIN-SHORTENED LPGA TOURNAMENT.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-LOPEZ WINS RAIN-SHORTENED LPGA TOURNAMENT.

text.p: Hall-of-Famer Nancy Lopez picked up her first LPGA Tour victory in four years as rain washed out Sunday's final round at the $550,000 Chick-Fil-A Charity Championship at Eagle's Landing.

The final round began late in the morning but play was suspended less than three hours later and tournament officials eventually decided to shorten the event to 36 holes and declared Lopez the winner.
Fifty-eight players completed their second round Sunday morning after a rain delay of nearly three hours halted play on Saturday.

Lopez completed her second round Sunday by shooting a six-under-par 66 to finish at seven-under 137, two shots ahead of Tina Barrett, Deb Richard, and Australia's Karrie Webb, who won last week's Susan G. Komen International.
Barrett carded a 69, while Richard and Webb shot 70s.
The 40-year-old Lopez claimed her 48th career victory and first since the 1993 Youngstown-Warren Classic. She picked up a first prize of $82,500.
"A win is a win," said Lopez.
